dc:title: Fall Appeal - November 1967
dc:creator: Dorothy Day
dc:description: An appeal for money. Notes their hospitality for the families of migrants, for pickets in the grape boycott, and the many apartments they rent. "Even as I am writing this a woman comes to borrow twenty-five dollars. She does this every so often and it usually is a dire need."
dc:identifier: Dorothy Day Library on the Web document 856 1967-11-01 James Allaire Creative Commons Non-Commercial Share Alike 3.0 en-US http://www.catholicworker.org/dorothyday
